title: 113_hr3782
content: The "Native American Seeds Protection Act of 2013" is introduced to provide research grants for the protection and preservation of Native American seeds under the National Agricultural Research, Extension, and Teaching Policy Act of 1977. The Secretary may provide grants and enter agreements with eligible entities for research on Native American seed purity. Grant applications must involve cooperation with other research entities. Funding can be used for assessing the impacts of laws and policies on traditional practices. The Secretary may provide grants and agreements for research on Native American seed purity, focusing on public policies, contaminants, education, and training programs. Reports on research findings are to be submitted annually to relevant committees. The Secretary may provide grants for research on Native American seed purity, education, and training programs. Reports on research findings are to be submitted annually to relevant committees. Eligible entities include 1994 Institutions and Indian tribes. The term 'Indian tribe' and 'qualified research entity' are defined in the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act. The Secretary is required to issue regulations within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary will issue regulations to define "Native American seed" as part of the National Agricultural Research Act. Section 306 (a)(19)(A) of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include the development of seed storage facilities for Native American seeds.
